Description: Laconian black-figured pottery kylix (restored from numerous fragments and added plaster, notably part of one handle and the stemmed foot); dull brownish cream slip; interior: black band at top of rim above band of alternating black and added red tongues between black bands; below, on bowl, lotus bud band between black and red bands above second band of red and black tongues between red and black bands; below, band of lotus buds and trace of band of dots; exterior: black band at top of otherwise reserved lip; in handle zone, part of incised handle palmette decorated with red and frieze of lotus buds between black bands; on wall below, band of slim rays between black and red bands, above band of red and black tongues also between red and black bands; traco of black at junction of bowl and foot, band of narrow rising rays; inscription on outside of lip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 208-9, no. 9, pl. 8,1-2)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 766, pl. XXI, no. 766)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.72) (phase 3)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 417)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 395, no 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
